result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan R. Griffin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jonathan R. Griffin is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jonathan R. Griffin was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Processed Financial Request Form

Clerk: Amanda.
Case called at 9:13 am.
State of Wisconsin appears by ADA Cody Marschall.  Defendant appears from MCJ, pro se. 

Date and Time set for discussions re: Speedy Trial Demand requested 5/31.
VRCW. 

State notes that parties have had discussions and reached an agreement. 
Defendant is ready to proceed with a Plea today.

State moves to: 
DISMISS Ct.1(Battery/Repeater[Domestic Abuse]).
AMEND Ct.2(DC/Repeater[Domestic Abuse]) to County DC, pursuant to statute 9.21; 

COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA to Ct.2(DC)>>NO CONTEST.

COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, defendant is competent to represent self, a factual basis & defendant guilty;

COURT ORDERS: Pay $5 forfeiture + CC. 

Adj: 9:17 am.

Public Safety Assessment Report

No contact with victim(s): F.D.B. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence. Absolute sobriety from, and no possession of alcohol. Absolute sobriety from, and no possession of controlled substances, except prescriptions taken as prescribed. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 2 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Clerk: Amanda.
Case called at 2:05 pm.
State appears by ADA Cody Marschall. Defendant appears from MCJ, and with Attorney Trevor Peterson. 
Date and Time set for IA; VRCW. 

Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 

PLEA:  NOT GUILTY. 

PO HOLD. 

COURT ORDERS: $750 cash bond - CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): F.D.B. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
- Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence. 
- Absolute sobriety from, and no possession of alcohol. 
- Absolute sobriety from, and no possession of controlled substances, except prescriptions taken as prescribed. 
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 2 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
